intSingularH_tria3.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : intSingularH_tria3.c                                            *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Computes the integral of the Green's function normal derivative H for one   *
00009 * element when the collocation point is one of the nodes of the integration   *
00010 * element, and returns the values for all shape functions in vector Int[].    *
00011 * Uses element subdivision and standard Gauss-Legendre quadrature integration.*
00012 * Works for linear interpolation in triangular elements (3-noded triangles).  *
00013 ******************************************************************************/
00014 
00015 /******************************************************************************
00016 * COPYRIGHT & LICENSE INFORMATION                                             *
00017 *                                                                             *
00018 * Copyright 2006 Carlos Rosales Fernandez and The Institute of High           *
00019 * Performance Computing (A*STAR)                                              *
00020 *                                                                             *
00021 * This file is part of depSolver.                                             *
00022 *                                                                             *
00023 * depSolver is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify           *
00024 * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by        *
00025 * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or           *
00026 * (at your option) any later version.                                         *
00027 *                                                                             *
00028 * depSolver is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,                *
00029 * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of              *
00030 * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the               *
00031 * GNU General Public License for more details.                                *
00032 *                                                                             *
00033 * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License           *
00034 * along with depSolver; if not, write to the Free Software                    *
00035 * Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301  USA  *
00036 ******************************************************************************/
00037 
00038 #include "integral_tria3.h"
00039 
00040 int intSingularH_tria3(const unsigned int FLAG, unsigned int SinNode, 
00041                        double X[3][3], double *Xeval, double *Int, 
00042                        double *normal)
00043 {
00044     const unsigned int NODES_IN_ELEM = 3;
00045     unsigned int i, j, k, m;
00046     double A, B, C, dx, dy, dz, J, JL, nxdx, rsq, W, M1, M2, M3;
00047     double L[2], N[3], XL[3];
00048     double xs[3][3][2];
00049  
00050     /* Initialize */
00051     if(!FLAG) Int[0] = Int[1] = Int[2] = 0.0;
00052     else for(i = 0; i < 9; i++) Int[i] = 0.0;
00053     for(i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00054         for(j = 0; j < 3; j++)
00055             for(k = 0; k <2; k++) xs[i][j][k] = 0.0;
00056 
00057     /* Reorder so that singularity is at node 3 */
00058     if(SinNode == 1){
00059         for(i = 0; i < 3; i++) shift(X[2][i],X[0][i],X[1][i]);
00060     }
00061     else if(SinNode == 2){
00062         for(i = 0; i < 3; i++) shift(X[2][i],X[1][i],X[0][i]);
00063     }
00064 
00065     /* Setup 3 initial triangles */
00066     xs[0][0][0] = 1.0;  xs[0][0][1] = 0.0;
00067     xs[0][1][0] = 0.5;  xs[0][1][1] = 0.5;
00068     xs[0][2][0] = 0.5;  xs[0][2][1] = 0.0;
00069 
00070     xs[1][0][0] = 0.5;  xs[1][0][1] = 0.0;
00071     xs[1][1][0] = 0.5;  xs[1][1][1] = 0.5;
00072     xs[1][2][0] = 0.0;  xs[1][2][1] = 0.5;
00073     
00074     xs[2][0][0] = 0.5;  xs[2][0][1] = 0.5;
00075     xs[2][1][0] = 0.0;  xs[2][1][1] = 1.0;
00076     xs[2][2][0] = 0.0;  xs[2][2][1] = 0.5;
00077     
00078     /* Start subdivision loop */
00079     J = 1.0;
00080     for(m = 0; m < NSUBDIVISIONS; m++){
00081         J = J*0.25;
00082     
00083         /* Integrate over the 3 triangles furthest away from the singularity */
00084         for(i = 0; i < 3; i++){
00085             
00086             /* Integrate over each triangle using Gauss-Legendre quadrature */
00087             for(j = 0; j < TSNGAUSS; j++){
00088                 M1 = TSGauss[j][0];
00089                 M2 = TSGauss[j][1];
00090                 M3 = 1.0 - M1 - M2;
00091                 W = TSGauss[j][2];
00092                 
00093                 /**************************************************** 
00094                 * Get L and N as a function of (M1,M2). This is the *
00095                 * transformation between the unit triangle (M1,M2)  *
00096                 * and the smaller subtriangle (L1,L2)               *
00097                 ****************************************************/
00098                 L[0] = xs[i][0][0]*M1 + xs[i][1][0]*M2 + xs[i][2][0]*M3;
00099                 L[1] = xs[i][0][1]*M1 + xs[i][1][1]*M2 + xs[i][2][1]*M3;
00100                 shape_tria3(L,N);
00101                 JL = X2L_tria3(X,XL,L,N);
00102 
00103                 /* Auxiliar quantities */
00104                 dx = Xeval[0] - XL[0];
00105                 dy = Xeval[1] - XL[1];
00106                 dz = Xeval[2] - XL[2];
00107                 rsq = dx*dx + dy*dy + dz*dz;
00108                 A = J*JL*W/pow(rsq,1.5);
00109 
00110                 if(!FLAG){
00111                     nxdx = dx*normal[0]+dy*normal[1]+dz*normal[2];
00112                     A = A*nxdx;
00113                     Int[0] -= A*N[0];
00114                     Int[1] -= A*N[1];
00115                     Int[2] -= A*N[2];
00116                 }
00117                 else{
00118                     C = A*dz;
00119                     B = A*dy;
00120                     A = A*dx;
00121                     for(k = 0; k < NODES_IN_ELEM; k++){
00122                         Int[k*3] += A*N[k];
00123                         Int[k*3+1] += B*N[k];
00124                         Int[k*3+2] += C*N[k];
00125                     }
00126                 }
00127             }
00128         }
00129     
00130         /* Set triangles for new subdivision */
00131         for(i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
00132             for(j = 0; j < 3; j++){
00133                 xs[i][j][0] = xs[i][j][0]*0.5;
00134                 xs[i][j][1] = xs[i][j][1]*0.5;
00135             }
00136         }
00137     }
00138 
00139     /* Unscramble node contributions to return them in their right places */    
00140     if(FLAG == 0){
00141         if(SinNode == 1){
00142             shift(Int[1],Int[0],Int[2]);
00143         }
00144         else if(SinNode == 2){
00145             shift(Int[0],Int[1],Int[2]);
00146         }
00147     }
00148     else{
00149         if(SinNode == 1){
00150             for(i = 0; i < 3; i++) shift(Int[3+i],Int[i],Int[6+i]);
00151         }
00152         else if(SinNode == 2){
00153             for(i = 0; i < 3; i++) shift(Int[i],Int[3+i],Int[6+i]);
00154         }
00155     }
00156 
00157     return 0;
00158 }
